AhAuthenticationMethod.name: AhAuthenticationMethod
AhAuthenticationMethod.description: Authentication method supported by the HiveAP

AhEncrytionMethod.name: AhEncrytionMethod
AhEncrytionMethod.description: Encryption method supported by the HiveAP

ahTrapModule.name: ahTrapModule
ahTrapModule.description: This is the MIB module for access point trap definitions for Aerohive Networks Inc.

AhState.name: AhState
AhState.description: It defines the state for interfaces.

AhProbableCause.name: AhProbableCause
AhProbableCause.description: It defines the probable cause for a problem on the HiveAP.

ahFailureTrap.name: ahFailureTrap
ahFailureTrap.description: This event is generated for any equipment or software failures.

ahThresholdCrossingEvent.name: ahThresholdCrossingEvent
ahThresholdCrossingEvent.description: This event is generated whenever a threshold is crossed for the first time.

ahStateChangeEvent.name: ahStateChangeEvent
ahStateChangeEvent.description: This event is generated whenever an object state change occurs.

ahConnectionChangeEvent.name: ahConnectionChangeEvent
ahConnectionChangeEvent.description: This event is generated whenever a connection state change occurs. The connection might be between a HiveAP and its client, or between a HiveAP and a neighboring HiveAP.

ahIDPStationEvent.name: ahIDPStationEvent
ahIDPStationEvent.description: This event is generated whenever IDP detects an AP in its neighborhood. The ahRomoteId indicates the detected AP MAC address, and the ahIDPCompliance indicates conformance of IDP policy this AP satisfies. The ahIDPChannel and ahIDPRSSI indicates the radio channel and Receive Signal Strenth Indication.

ahClientInfoEvent.name: ahClientInfoEvent
ahClientInfoEvent.description: This event is generated whenever HiveAP a new client makes an association and its IP address, hostname, and User name is obtained.

ahPoEEvent.name: ahPoEEvent
ahPoEEvent.description: This event is generated whenever a HiveAP (802.11n product line) boots up or changes power levels.

ahChannelPowerChangeEvent.name: ahChannelPowerChangeEvent
ahChannelPowerChangeEvent.description: This event is generated whenever a HiveAP boots up, or changes channels or power levels.

ahIDPMitigateEvent.name: ahIDPMitigateEvent
ahIDPMitigateEvent.description: This event is generated whenever IDP detects an rogue client connect to a rogue AP. The ahRomoteId indicates the detected Station MAC address.

ahInterferenceMapAlertEvent.name: ahInterferenceMapAlertEvent
ahInterferenceMapAlertEvent.description: For every one minute interval, AP will monitor the interference channel utilizations (snapshot, short term means average and running average) and CRC error rate against their thresholds, if any one of them is above their threshold (thresholds are settable by CLI), AP should send HM an interference alert event to HM. AP will send out clear alert to HM only when: the last short term period s CRC-error-rate, means average Interference CU and the last snapshot interference CU are all below their thresholds.

ahBandwidthSentinelEvent.name: ahBandwidthSentinelEvent
ahBandwidthSentinelEvent.description: HiveOS will send two different kinds of traps: bandwidth sentinel alert trap, and bandwidth sentinel clear trap. The alert trap will serve the purpose to tell HM that the client is violating the bandwidth sentinel, the clear trap will clear the previous alert trap.

ahAlarmMsgMapAlertEvent.name: ahAlarmMsgMapAlertEvent
ahAlarmMsgMapAlertEvent.description: HiveOS will send two different kinds of level alert: interface level alert, and client level alert. There are four alert types, CRC error rate, TX drop/retry rate, Rx drop rate; interface level includes all alert type, the client level includes Tx drop/retry rate, Rx drop Rate; the 'set' alert means there is an alert raised, with type indicated in the alert type field, the 'clear' alert means the previous alert condition has been cleared.

ahAPId.name: ahAPId
ahAPId.description: It is the node ID (MAC address in hexadecimal format) of the HiveAP where the trap is generated. If a HiveAP is configured with 2 hives, the node ID is the first MAC address of the management interface.

ahAPName.name: ahAPName
ahAPName.description: The host name of the HiveAP where the trap is generated.

ahSeverity.name: ahSeverity
ahSeverity.description: It contains the serverity of the trap.

ahObjectName.name: ahObjectName
ahObjectName.description: It describes the object for which the trap is generated.

ahProbableCause.name: ahProbableCause
ahProbableCause.description: It describes the probable cause of a problem.

ahCurValue.name: ahCurValue
ahCurValue.description: It contains the current value of a threshold counter.

ahThresholdHigh.name: ahThresholdHigh
ahThresholdHigh.description: It contains the value for a high threshold.

ahThresholdLow.name: ahThresholdLow
ahThresholdLow.description: It contains the value for a low threshold.

ahPreviousState.name: ahPreviousState
ahPreviousState.description: It contains the value for a previous state.

ahCurrentState.name: ahCurrentState
ahCurrentState.description: It contains the value for the current state.

ahTrapDesc.name: ahTrapDesc
ahTrapDesc.description: It contains the description of the trap.

ahCode.name: ahCode
ahCode.description: It contains access information to the Aerohive logging/action dictionary.

ahIfIndex.name: ahIfIndex
ahIfIndex.description: The interface index used to identify uniquely an interface (logical or physical).

ahObjectType.name: ahObjectType
ahObjectType.description: It specifies the object type: a client link or a neighbor link.

ahRemoteId.name: ahRemoteId
ahRemoteId.description: It is the MAC address of the remote node. If the remote node is a HiveAP, the ID must be the MAC address of its management interface. If the remote node is a client station, it must be the MAC address of the client.

ahIDPType.name: ahIDPType
ahIDPType.description: It is used to indicate the AP identified is a rogue, or valid, or compliant, or noncompliant, or external AP.

ahIDPChannel.name: ahIDPChannel
ahIDPChannel.description: It is the channel number used by the identified AP.

ahIDPRSSI.name: ahIDPRSSI
ahIDPRSSI.description: It is the RSSI for the identified AP or Client.

ahIDPCompliance.name: ahIDPCompliance
ahIDPCompliance.description: It is bit mask to indicate which policy the indentified AP is compliant with (bit is set if it is NOT compliant).

ahSSID.name: ahSSID
ahSSID.description: It contains the SSID name for the detected AP.

ahStationType.name: ahStationType
ahStationType.description: It indicates whether it is event for a peer AP or client PC

ahIDPStationData.name: ahIDPStationData
ahIDPStationData.description: It is bit mask to indicate policies are detected for the identified AP . Note: the oui-policy and ssid-policy are omitted due to the presence of the ahRemoteID, and SSID in the trap message.

ahRemoved.name: ahRemoved
ahRemoved.description: It indicates whether the AP or client can not be detected.

ahClientMAC.name: ahClientMAC
ahClientMAC.description: It contains the MAC address of the wireless client. It is required.

ahCLientIP.name: ahCLientIP
ahCLientIP.description: It contains the IP address of the wireless client. It is optional.

ahClientHostName.name: ahClientHostName
ahClientHostName.description: It contains the host name of the wireless client. It is optional.

ahClientUserName.name: ahClientUserName
ahClientUserName.description: It contains the user name of the wireless client. It is optional.

ahPowerSrc.name: ahPowerSrc
ahPowerSrc.description: It indicates whether the power source is from the power adaptor or PoE. If the power source is the adaptor, PoE information in the trap is ignored.

ahPoEEth0On.name: ahPoEEth0On
ahPoEEth0On.description: It indicates whether PoE is on eth0 or not.

ahPoEEth0Pwr.name: ahPoEEth0Pwr
ahPoEEth0Pwr.description: It indicates the power level of PoE in watts multiply by 10.

ahPoEEth1On.name: ahPoEEth1On
ahPoEEth1On.description: It indicates whether PoE is on eth1 or not.

ahPoEEth1Pwr.name: ahPoEEth1Pwr
ahPoEEth1Pwr.description: It indicates the power level of PoE on eht1 in watts multiply by 10.

ahRadioChannel.name: ahRadioChannel
ahRadioChannel.description: It is the channel number currently in use for this radio.

ahRadioTxPower.name: ahRadioTxPower
ahRadioTxPower.description: It is the transmit power in dBm that the radio is currently using. The range is 0 to 20 dBm.

ahClientAuthMethod.name: ahClientAuthMethod
ahClientAuthMethod.description: It is the authentication method the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientEncryptionMethod.name: ahClientEncryptionMethod
ahClientEncryptionMethod.description: It is the encryption method the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientMACProtocol.name: ahClientMACProtocol
ahClientMACProtocol.description: It is the radio mode the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientVLAN.name: ahClientVLAN
ahClientVLAN.description: It is the VLAN that the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientUserProfId.name: ahClientUserProfId
ahClientUserProfId.description: It is the user profile ID that the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientChannel.name: ahClientChannel
ahClientChannel.description: It is the radio channel that the client uses when communicating with the HiveAP.

ahClientCWPUsed.name: ahClientCWPUsed
ahClientCWPUsed.description: It is the Boolean datatype indicating whether a captive web portal is used.

ahBSSID.name: ahBSSID
ahBSSID.description: It is the basic service set identifier of the client if the ahRemoteId is a client.

ahPoEEth0MaxSpeed.name: ahPoEEth0MaxSpeed
ahPoEEth0MaxSpeed.description: It is the automatically adjusted maximum Ethernet speed based on the power source and level.

ahPoEEth1MaxSpeed.name: ahPoEEth1MaxSpeed
ahPoEEth1MaxSpeed.description: It is the automatically adjusted maximum Ethernet speed based on the power source and level.

ahPoEWifi0Setting.name: ahPoEWifi0Setting
ahPoEWifi0Setting.description: It is the automatically adjusted Wi-Fi setting based on the power source and power level.

ahPoEWifi1Setting.name: ahPoEWifi1Setting
ahPoEWifi1Setting.description: It is the automatically adjusted Wi-Fi setting based on the power source and power level.

ahPoEWifi2Setting.name: ahPoEWifi2Setting
ahPoEWifi2Setting.description: It is the automatically adjusted Wi-Fi setting based on the power source and power level.

ahAssociationTime.name: ahAssociationTime
ahAssociationTime.description: The association time(s) of client connect or disconnect to AP.

ahIDPInNet.name: ahIDPInNet
ahIDPInNet.description: It is the Boolean datatype indicating whether AP is in local network.

ahDiscoverAge.name: ahDiscoverAge
ahDiscoverAge.description: It is the age from the rogue client is discovered.

ahUpdateAge.name: ahUpdateAge
ahUpdateAge.description: It is the age from the rogue client is updated.

ahShortTermInterference.name: ahShortTermInterference
ahShortTermInterference.description: channel utilizations short term interference. The short term period is defined by CLI config, usually, it should be in the range of 5 minutes to 30 minutes.

ahSnapshotInterference.name: ahSnapshotInterference
ahSnapshotInterference.description: channel utilizations snapshot interference. it is the last minute s means average.

ahFailureSet.name: ahFailureSet
ahFailureSet.description: It is the Boolean datatype indicating whether this failure(alert) is on or off.

ahInterferenceThreshold.name: ahInterferenceThreshold
ahInterferenceThreshold.description: the configured channel utilizations interference threshold. it is defined by CLI config.

ahCRCErrRateThreshold.name: ahCRCErrRateThreshold
ahCRCErrRateThreshold.description: the configured CRC error rate threshold. it is defined by CLI config.

ahCRCErrRate.name: ahCRCErrRate
ahCRCErrRate.description: short term CRC error rate. The interval of the refresh of CRC error rate calculation is the same interval as channel utilization short term means average interval.

ahBandwidthSentinelStatus.name: ahBandwidthSentinelStatus
ahBandwidthSentinelStatus.description: Bandwidth sentinel status. In alert message, the value should be zero. In clear message, the value should be 1.

ahGuaranteedBandwidth.name: ahGuaranteedBandwidth
ahGuaranteedBandwidth.description: the configured guaranteed bandwidth(Kbps). it is defined by CLI config.

ahBandwidthSentinelAction.name: ahBandwidthSentinelAction
ahBandwidthSentinelAction.description: bit maps to indicate which action has been taken on this client. bit 0: indicate whether log the guaranteed bandwidth violation or not, bit 1: indicate whether add more token to meet the minimum guaranteed bandwidth or not.

ahBeaconInterval.name: ahBeaconInterval
ahBeaconInterval.description: It is the number of time units between Beacon transmissions, One time unit is 1024 microseconds.

ahLevel.name: ahLevel
ahLevel.description: The level value will tell HM whether this is an interface level alert or a client alert.

ahAlarmAlertType.name: ahAlarmAlertType
ahAlarmAlertType.description: There are five types, CRC Rate only applies to interface level alert, TX drop/retry rate is is calculated based on retries over total unicast TX frames, RX drop rate is calculated based on the dropped RX frames over total RX frames, Airtime percentage is the sum of both TX and RX airtime percentages.

ahThresholdValue.name: ahThresholdValue
ahThresholdValue.description: the configured CRC error rate, TX drop/retry rate, RX drop rate threshold. it is defined by CLI config.

ahShortTermValue.name: ahShortTermValue
ahShortTermValue.description: the percentage of this sampling period, CRC error rate, TX drop/retry rate, RX drop rate.

ahSnapshotValue.name: ahSnapshotValue
ahSnapshotValue.description: the snapshot value of CRC error rate, TX drop/retry rate, RX drop rate.

ahIfName.name: ahIfName
ahIfName.description: Name - uniquely identifies an AP Interface.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 17:56:55 2021
